q: Aaron Rodgers . He'd been in the bullpen for three years and everyone knew he was ready." On draft day, however, the Packers were far from convinced that Aaron Rodgers would be exceptional. I kept Aaron Rodgers and his agent on hold for an agonizing ten minutes per Ted's instructions while waiting to see if the phone would ring with an offer we couldn't refuse. Extra point: If you had to pick a quarterback to start for your team next season, where would you rank Aaron Rodgers among these six peers? Tom Brady , Peyton Manning , Drew Brees , Philip Rivers , Michael Vick and Ben Roethlisberger

Eric Schmidt , previously CEO of Novell and CTO of Sun Microsystems, has by far the most enterprise experience in the triumvirate that runs Google, which also includes co-founder Sergey Brin . Eric Schmidt clearly had passion for enterprise software, says Gartner analyst Whit Andrews. "He cared about enterprise software. He worked at a lot of companies that sold enterprise software and bunch of enterprise products. That history is not in place with Page."

it is right to give someone a second chance." Asked about the suggestion that Mr Andy Coulson had offered to quit, Mr David Cameron insisted he would not comment on "private conversations". Of course he, as anyone who is human would be, is extremely embarrassed by the endless publicity and speculation about what happened many years ago when he was editor of the News of the World. But he praised Mr Andy Coulson 's performance in his current role, saying the Downing Street press office worked in a very "proper" way and he had not received a single complaint.

In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana," Mike Pence , R-Columbus, said of himself and wife Karen in a letter being sent to supporters. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012.
